result.execSummary:
The defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Freddie E Sparks Ward is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Freddie E Sparks Ward was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance. No consumption of alcohol. No going to any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale or consumption of alcohol. No contact with anyone known or susupected of being in a gang, consuming illegal drugs, or engaging in criminal activity. Mental health assessment and follow-through. 
Bond to be applied to fines/cost; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Court calls the defendant in Oshkosh Correctional, per records department the defendant has not shown for his telephone appearance and a notice was given to him yesterday by the records department.
Atty Hendee asks the court to deny the petition for sentence adjustment.

BY THE COURT:  Based on non-appearance of the defendant by telephone, the defendant's motion is denied.
Motion hearing on May 22, 2019 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI.  Atty Frank received a copy of the PSI and have no changes but wants to clarify a couple of things.
Alyssa Burke is called by telephone.  Examined by Atty Frank.  Examined by Atty Hendee.  Witness excused.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 7 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 3 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
Report Forthwith; defendant is remanded into custody
Credit = 8 days
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Absolute sobriety; zero tolerance
No consumption or possession of any alcohol
No going to any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale or consumption of alcohol. 
No contact with anyone known or suspected of being in a gang, consuming illegal drugs, or engaging in criminal activity. 
Mental health assessment and follow-through. 
AODA and any follow-up treatment. 
Is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Is eligible for the Challange Incarceration Program

Bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to 961.41(1)(cm)(1R).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to that amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismiss.  Atty Hendee states that parties would be requesting a PSI.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
PSI ordered.
Set for Sentencing
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Signed by BNB/10-19-16
Plea hearing on October 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant had a warrant out of Dane County and currently serving jail time in Dane County.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does have huber but he did not have a ride here.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset; there is an agreement.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.

Atty Gumz asks to send the notice to Dane County Ferris Center.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Final pre-trial on August 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR112 tracking with:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz states that there was an amended complaint filed.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant does not understand it fully.  Atty Gumz asks for a brief recess.  
BY THE COURT:  Recess for Atty Gumz to speak with his client.

Back on the record:

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Preliminary hearing at 04-06-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the information was not filed due to there was further information on the tests; the State has filed an amended criminal complaint in the matter now.  Atty Hendee stipulates to the defendant waiving the Prelim on the matter.  
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the amended criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz withdraws the waiver of the Prelim that was previously done.
BY THE COURT:  Waiver of Prelim withdrawn.
Set for Prelim; time limits waived.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Arraignment at 03-03-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Freddie E Sparks Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees to the waiver on Ct. 1 and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee asks the court to allow 30 days to file the information with the Court.  
BY THE COURT:  Set for Arraignment.

Atty Gumz filed a motion yesterday for a bail modification.
Atty Hendee has no objection to hear the motion today.
Atty Gumz states motion and asks that the bail be amended to $2,500 cash.
Atty Hendee objects to the bail modification.
Atty Gumz states that he will be appointing counsel for the Dane County case also.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reduce the cash bond to a $5,000 cash bond with same conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Preliminary hearing at 01-28-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant appears by video. D.A. gave appearances & charges. 
Court has copy of complaint. Gave charges & penalties. 
Defendant received complaint.
Court advised right to attorney. D.A. requests $10,000 cash bond with no contact with Starnika Wells. Gave explanation of high cash bond request. Defendant has felony warrant out of another county for non-appearance. 
Court asked defendant about bond. Defendant made statement regarding no contact. Court responded.
 Court set $10,000.00 cash bond. Condition of no contact with Starnika Wells, co-defendant.
Court advised time limits to hold pre-lim within ten days unless waived. Defendant stated he did not know what preliminary hearing was. Court explained what pre-lim is.
